item.title: 9 Everyday verbs 3
item.description: Have Take Break smash verb [transitive] to break something with a lot of force A policeman smashed his camera. snap verb [transitive] to break something into two pieces, making a loud noise – used especially about long thin objects He snapped the sticks in two. split verb [transitive] to separate something into two pieces along a straight line Using a sharp knife, split the melon in half.
